title: La Vuelta a España 2021 Standings after Stage 17
content:
General Classification / Red Jersey 

Roglič left no doubt about his ability to win a third consecutive Vuelta a España in Stage 17. Egan Bernal bravely attacked with 60km to go but cracked towards the end of the stage while Roglič continued alone, winning the stage by over a minute ahead of his rivals. Odd Christian Eiking surrendered the red jersey early on in the stage, struggling on the first climbs and eventually crashing on a wet descent. Roglič now leads the GC by over two minutes ahead of Movistar's Enric Mas.
